title: When Central Banks Whisper Winter: What It Means for Markets and Economy
description: Central Banks News: November always brings that strange northern-hemisphere twilight where the sun clocks out early, and the central bank economic forecast chills begin to creep under the market’s door. Yes, it’s the season when the world’s central banks drag out their annual financial-stability rep...

title: Breman ‘Gifted’ Ideal Economy as She Takes Charge at the RBNZ
description:
(Bloomberg) -- Sweden’s Anna Breman is taking the helm of New Zealand’s central bank at an ideal time, according to the man she’s replacing.

Breman, who begins her five-year term as Reserve Bank governor Monday in Wellington, inherits an economy embarking on a robust recovery just as inflation trac...

title: The fall of Northvolt, Sweden's symbol of green reindustrialization
description: In DepthOn March 12, the electric battery giant shut its doors for good. Nearly 5,000 people employed at the Skelleftea gigafactory lost their jobs. As the US-based company Lyten prepares to restart production, Northvolt's downfall has cast a chill over Sweden's ambitions to reindustrialize around c...

title: Thai Senate budget committee visits Sweden for talks on fiscal oversight
description: The Royal Thai Embassy in Stockholm has hosted a visit by the Thai Senate Standing Committee on Monitoring Budget Administration as part of a study trip to Sweden. On 17 November 2025, Ambassador Arurung Phothong Humphreys welcomed the delegation at the embassy, together with Minister Counsellor Pit...

title: Sweden's Debt Office Expects Widening Budget Deficit, Increases Borrowing Plans — 2nd Update
description:
By Emese Bartha

Sweden's central government will need to increase its borrowing due to a growing budget deficit expected for both 2026 and 2027, mainly on the back of an expansionary fiscal policy, the National Debt Office said.

In a borrowing review on Thursday, the NDO said it expects a budget d...
